[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Unknown, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
I would tell about my progress of planning my trip to Sweden.
How is the trip to Sweden going anyways?
I am still in the planning stages, since my cousin lives over there, she is helping me to plan it. Any must sees while I am there?
It really depends! Personally, I love the castles! Visby is probably my favorite spot. 
Okay, I will see if there are any castles near where we will be. Do you have any plans to go back to sweden?
Not in the near future, but I'm hoping to get back next summer. I love hitting up all the local beach spots with my old friends.
That sounds nice! So how is your job going?
Always interesting, that's for sure! I have been training to nurse on a new floor, so that'll give me a change of scenery.

[MEMORY]
Related Evidences: (1) {'Related Topics': 'travel and vacations', 'Related Summaries': 'Speaker A and Speaker B discuss traveling to Sweden, vacation plans, and recommendations for activities in Sweden.', 'Related Dialogues': '### Speaker A: It is rewarding but is very difficult work at times. That's why I often need some time to decompress and be active. ### Speaker B: At least it is rewarding. Being active is amazing, I have yet to try playing badminton. ### Speaker A: Because my job is flexible, I have been thinking of taking a second part time job to help save money to travel to Sweden.  ### Speaker B: That's awesome! Its so important to take time off and vacation. I can tell you all the cool spots to check out in Sweden. Maybe we could go together since I miss Sweden so much.. I had so many great memories there. ### Speaker A: Yeah that would be great. What would you recommend first that we do when we get there? ### Speaker B: For a newcomer, I'd recommend checking out the volcanos. Its a bit of a unique outing, but I think they are really beautiful. Do you have any favorite things to do when traveling>? ### Speaker A: Yes, I always like to check out local music and local coffee shops for random conversations. Would you want to do that? ### Speaker B: Same! I'm so glad you said that. Coffee shops are literally my favorite thing in the whole world, and Sweden has some awesome ones. I think growing up there is what sparked my interest in good coffee as well as good chocolates' }
```
